content: --कविः ‘the first poet’, an epithet of Brahmā and of Vālmīki; the former is so called because he first produced and promulgated the Vedas; and the latter, because he was the first to show to others ‘the path of poets’; when he beheld one of a pair of Krauñca birds being killed by a fowler, he cursed the wretch, and his grief unconsciously took the form of a verse (श्लोकत्वमापद्यत यस्य शोकः); he was subsequently told by Brahmā to compose the life of Rāma, and he thus gave to the world the first poem in Sanskrit, the Rāmāyaṇa; <ab>cf.</ab> <ls>U. 2</ls> Viṣkambhaka.
